intro: Hoffmannseggia tenella, commonly known as the narrowleaf hoffmannseggia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its spineless, cylindrical stems. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is often found in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Hoffmannseggia tenella is a succulent plant that stores water in its stems, allowing it to survive in dry conditions.
